fields.headline: The cookery course
fields.bodyText: A new cookery school on a working farm opens on the edge of the Cotswolds tomorrow. Each student at the Eckington Manor Cookery School near Pershore will have his or her own 'mini-kitchen' area, with a Falcon, Rangemaster or Aga cooker and a stocked fridge. There are 10 of these around a central demonstration area. Guests stay in the 700-year-old timber-framed house on the 260-acre Manor Farm, and cook with the farm's products. A wide range of courses, from an Aga taster day to sushi, bread or chocolate classes cost from £150 a day for the course, £75 a night for accommodation. Contact 01386 751 363; eckingtonmanor.co.uk.
